senses.de: To recognize the worth of something or someone

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Using 'appreciate' can express deep acknowledgement and respect towards others.
Tips.example: I appreciate your dedication to this project.

Tips.title: Positive Politeness
Tips.description: 'Appreciate' often functions to make requests sound more polite and considerate.
Tips.example: I would appreciate your immediate response.

Tips.title: Cultural Sensitivity
Tips.description: In some cultures, saying 'I appreciate you' is a heartfelt compliment and can be very meaningful.
Tips.example: You're a great friend, and I appreciate you.

senses.ex: After trying to do it myself, I appreciate how difficult it is

Tips.title: Personal Insight
Tips.description: Using 'appreciate' shows you've thought about the subject and understand it deeply.
Tips.example: I truly appreciate the complexity of this issue.

Tips.title: After Experience
Tips.description: Express 'appreciate' after experiencing something to show a new level of understanding.
Tips.example: Having tried it myself, I appreciate the effort it takes.

Tips.title: Not Immediate
Tips.description: Appreciation can imply that understanding wasn't immediate but developed over time.
Tips.example: I've come to appreciate the subtleties of her art.

senses.ex: Over time, the property will appreciate in value

Tips.title: Long-term Value
Tips.description: 'Appreciate' in financial contexts implies an increase in value over time, not immediately.
Tips.example: The collection may appreciate in value years from now.

Tips.title: Investment Potential
Tips.description: Use 'appreciate' to suggest that an asset is a good long-term investment.
Tips.example: Your vintage stamps should appreciate with time.

senses.ex: I would appreciate it if you could make a reservation for us

Tips.title: Conditional Gratitude
Tips.description: 'Appreciate' is often used when thanking in advance for a favor or service you hope for.
Tips.example: I would appreciate your discretion in this matter.

Tips.title: Strengthening Requests
Tips.description: 'Appreciate' can make a request sound more urgent while still being courteous.
Tips.example: I'd appreciate a reply at your earliest convenience.

Acknowledge.wordDefinition: Both words acknowledge and appreciate signify different meanings. Acknowledge means to acknowledge the existence or truth of something, to recognize someone's presence or contributions or just a simple response to express that you have received a message or an email.

Admire.wordDefinition:
Admire means having a high opinion of someone or something. It usually suggests that we look up to someone and feel respect for them.

We admire people for their talents, skills, or achievements.

Admire is used when we want to express respect for someone or something they have achieved, while appreciate is used when we want to express gratitude or enjoyment for something or someone that we like.

Cherish.wordDefinition:
Cherish means to hold something dear and treat it with love and care.

This word is often used to describe sentimental or emotional attachment. For example, you might cherish a special object that has sentimental value, cherish memories, or cherish a relationship with someone.

To appreciate is to recognize and value something, while to cherish is to hold something dear and treat it with love and care.

Comprehend.wordDefinition:
Comprehend means to fully understand or grasp something.

It is usually used when someone needs to fully understand a concept or idea to use it effectively. For example, when you comprehend a math formula, you are able to use it to solve equations.

Appreciate is more related to gratitude and admiration for something, while comprehend is more related to understanding and fully grasping a concept.

Esteem.wordDefinition:
Esteem means to hold someone or something in high regard or highest respect. This refers to a higher level of admiration, respect or value that someone holds for something or someone as opposed to merely appreciating them.

To put it simply, we appreciate things and people for their worth, while we esteem them for their high value or special qualities.

Both words can be used interchangeably, but esteem is often used in a stronger sense when describing the relationship between people.

Grasp.wordDefinition:
Grasp means to understand or comprehend something. It is applicable when referring to things that you learn or come to understand, such as a new concept or idea.

For example, you might appreciate a beautiful sunset, but to grasp the concept of space-time continuum in physics requires a greater level of understanding.

Recognize.wordDefinition:
Recognize means to acknowledge or be aware of someone or something. For example, you can recognize a celebrity on the street or recognize your mistake in an exam.

Both words can be used to express gratitude but appreciate is more emotional whereas recognize is more factual or objective.

Appreciate is used to express emotions of gratitude, admiration or enjoyment, while recognize is used to acknowledge, identify or admit something.

Respect.wordDefinition:
Both appreciate and respect are words that are used to describe positive feelings towards someone or something, but they have different meanings and applications.

Respect means to hold someone or something in high regard or esteem. When you respect someone, you recognize their authority, position, or achievements.

For example, you might respect a teacher who has a lot of experience and knowledge, or you might respect your parents because they provide for you and take care of you.

Respect is often used to show deference, honor, or recognition.

In summary, both words are positive ways to express admiration towards someone or something, but appreciate is more focused on recognizing the value or worth of someone or something, while respect is more focused on holding someone or something in high regard or esteem.

Understand.wordDefinition:
Understand is used when you comprehend or grasp the meaning of something. For example, you can understand a difficult concept or a language.

You appreciate when you value something emotionally, and you understand when you comprehend something rationally.

Value.wordDefinition:
Value means the worth or importance of something. It's usually used when something is seen as important or beneficial.

For example, "I value honesty in my friends." it is applicable when you are expressing what you think is important.

quotes.Text: What's amazing is, if young people understood how doing well in school makes the rest of their life so much interesting, they would be more motivated. It's so far away in time that they can't appreciate what it means for their whole life.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Bill Gates

quotes.Text: When I was playing before I retired, I never really understood the appreciation and the respect that people gave me. People had treated me like a god or something, and that was very embarrassing.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: Michael Jordan

quotes.Text: I'm screamingly funny, you know, I really am in the books. And that helps because I'm funnier than a lot of people, I think, and that's appreciated by young people.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.Text: The aim of life is appreciation; there is no sense in not appreciating things; and there is no sense in having more of them if you have less appreciation of them.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.Text: I got a lot of support from my parents. That's the one thing I always appreciated. They didn't tell me I was being stupid; they told me I was being funny.
quotes.Title: Canadian Comedian
quotes.Name: Jim Carrey

quotes.Text: If you have the opportunity to play this game of life you need to appreciate every moment. a lot of people don't appreciate the moment until it's passed.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Kanye West

quotes.Text: I think everybody deserves an equal amount of appreciation whether how old they are, but I mean, I'm cool with the praise. I'm good.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Billie Eilish

quotes.Text: In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: I really appreciate family. I really can't imagine life without them!
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ice Cube

quotes.Text: If not shown appreciation, it gets to you.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
